Let $\epsilon>0$. Is there some $r\ll_\epsilon 1$ such that the density of integers of the form $2^k+n$, where $k\geq 0$ and $n$ has at most $r$ prime divisors, is at least $1-\epsilon$?



Romanoff \cite{Ro34} proved that the set of integers of the form $2^k+p$ (where $p$ is prime) has positive lower density.

See also [205].




References


[Ro34] Romanoff, N. P., \"{U}ber einige S\"Atze der additiven Zahlentheorie. Math. Ann. (1934), 668-678.
